titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller family Associates, Berent Friele papers
A Guide to the Rockefeller family Associates, Berent Friele papers FA468

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-05 00:07:51 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller family Associates, Berent Friele papers

physdesc.extent: 19 letter document boxes, 1 legal document box.

did.physdesc: 20 document boxes. Box 20 is legal size.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The majority of this collection concerns Berent Friele's professional involvement in bettering relations between the United States and Brazil as an advisor and consul to Governor and then Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller on Latin America. The collection also documents some of Friele's activities pertaining to, or on behalf of, David Rockefeller focusing primarily in Latin America.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Berent Friele (1895-1985) was born the son of the co-owner of Friele & Sons of Bergen, Norway which was one of the leading coffee trading companies of its time. After finishing school in 1912, Friele went to Hamburg, Germany to work in the offices of a separate company involved in the coffee industry. During the World War I Friele moved to Brazil and continued working for the German coffee company before breaking off and forming his own company in Santos. While working in Brazil Friele developed his expertise in the cultivation of coffee and further developed his knowledge of the international coffee trade. In 1918 Friele came into contact with The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company (A&P) which contracted him to perform coffee purchases for the corporation; Friele would later form the American Coffee Corporation (ACC) as a subsidiary company of A&P in 1919. In the year 1920 Friele married Jenny Muller-Camps (1897-1985) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. By 1929 Friele had moved up within the ranks to become president of his original parent company, A&P.

Berent Friele was also instrumental in strengthening ties between the US and Latin America, especially Brazil. In 1934 he was named president of the American Brazilian Association and used his intimate knowledge of Latin America to advise US policymakers in their outreach towards Latin American countries. In 1940 he served with Nelson A. Rockefeller in the Office of the Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs (CIAA) marking the beginning of a lifelong friendship between them. The primary mission of the CIAA was to minimize German influence in Latin America while strengthening US ties with the region, in which both Berent Friele and Nelson Rockefeller played major roles. When Nelson Rockefeller was elected governor of New York in 1958, he appointed Friele his adviser on international relations, a position he retained when Nelson later became Vice President of the United States.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Berent Friele papers are arranged in five series:
Series 1: Biographical Materials. Series 2: General Correspondence. Series 3: Nelson Rockefeller Correspondence. Series 4: Business, Corporate, and Political Files. Series 5: Photographs.
Folders are arranged alphabetically while documents within folders remain in their original order, arranged primarily in reverse-chronological order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: RAC holds legal title, copyright, and literary property rights to the collection.
The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Advanced processing of the collection was conducted by Kyle LaVecchia, Rockefeller Archive Center summer intern, in 2013, to organize, describe, and prepare the materials for researcher access.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents and files of a personal nature belonging and pertaining to Berent Friele.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an assortment of documents, letters, and bulletins relating to an awards dinner in which Berent Friele was honored with the Distinguished Service Medal by Vice President Nelson Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Further correspondence, bulletins, and photographs relating to ACCION's awards dinner held in honor of Berent Friele. Includes several color photographs of Berent Friele accepting award as well as newspaper clippings of the event.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been physically separated from the original file, and relocated to their own folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains the documents describing the death and last years of Berent Friele's life, including his accomplishments and newspaper clippings.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been physically separated from the original file, and relocated to their own folder.

did.unittitle: Berent Friele Service Award and David Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence involving both Berent Friele and David Rockefeller regarding Berent's acceptance of the Distinguished Service Medal from ACCION.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, correspondence, and records of remarks made at a luncheon held by the Brazilian-American Chamber of Commerce in honor of Berent Friele.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A compilation of speeches by Berent Friele at a variety of dinners and events hosted by a multitude of organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of correspondence and letters sent between Berent Friele and his many colleagues, peers, and associates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and speeches regarding a dinner held by ACCION in honor of David Rockefeller for his contributions to inter-American relations.

did.unittitle: American Institute for Free Labor (AIFLD) and David Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter correspondence with David Rockefeller regarding the AIFLD.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter written to Brazilian Ambassador J.B. Pinheiro by Friele which expressing David Rockefeller's delight at being briefed on current relations between the US and Brazil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the activities of the Americas Foundation involving David Rockefeller. Includes invitation to an Americas Foundation Event.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence by David Rockefeller with Berent Friele BCC'd.

did.unittitle: Berent Friele, David Rockefeller, and Assis Chateaubriand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Berent Friele and David Rockefeller regarding their mutual associate, Assis Chateaubriand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assortment of letters and papers primarily written in Norwegian which are correspondence between Berent Friele and one Mr. Rieber of Norway.

did.unittitle: Brazilian Embassy Correspondence and Official Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many letters written both to and by Friele, generally in communication with associates working in the Brazilian embassy. Includes letters referencing Brazil's nuclear program. Includes newspaper clippings and address by Brazilian Ambassador J.B. Pinheiro.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Press, correspondence, and speeches regarding a Brazilian-New England conference hosted to promote trade and relations between the two areas. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A list of people with which Berent Friele had correspondence of well-wishing during the holiday season.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assortment of correspondence pertaining to Christmas well-wishing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assortment of correspondence pertaining to Christmas well-wishing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assortment of correspondence pertaining to Christmas well-wishing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a multitude of correspondence between Berent Friele and his associates ranging from business to personal in nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a multitude of correspondence between Berent Friele and his associates ranging from business to personal in nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a multitude of correspondence between Berent Friele and his associates ranging from business to personal in nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a multitude of correspondence between Berent Friele and his associates ranging from business to personal in nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a multitude of correspondence between Berent Friele and his associates ranging from business to personal in nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Berent Friele and Claude C. Erb, a Ph.D student who wrote his dissertation on Nelson Rockefeller and his involvement in bettering US-Latin American relations.

did.unittitle: Claude Erb and David Rockefeller Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assortment of letters and correspondence most often between David Rockefeller and Claude Erb, but also including Berent Friele.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a speech made by Nelson Rockefeller which was copied and sent to an editor associate of Friele for use as a citation in an article published by the University of Pittsburgh Press along with further general correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes further correspondence of Berent Friele with many different associates with last names beginning with L, most notably a letter which he sent to General Charles A. Lindbergh. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes further correspondence of Berent Friele with many different associates with last names beginning with F-I.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hand-written letters regarding business and investment opportunities in which Berent Friele was involved. Letters sent between Consul General of Denmark and Laurance S. Rockefeller discussing recent visit of Danish royalty to Virgin Islands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letter from TAP (Airline of Portugal) written to Friele thanking him for a letter he sent of his favorable evaluation of the airline. Most letters concern travels of Friele and his wife, Jenny. Also notable, a correspondence between Friele and one Morgan Trott of San Antonio, Texas writing about their mutual enthusiasm for the idea of the Pan-American Highway.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Several letters, some in Brazilian Portuguese, written between Friele and Brazilian dignitaries. Includes postcards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes well-wishing and letters written between one Dr. Janio and Friele.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assortment of letters with friends and colleagues ranging from well-wishing to business matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding meeting with notable Brazilian judges, economists, and politicians. Also a cordial invitation to a summit regarding international oil politics of which Berent is a council member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and information relating to one Marcus Vinicius Pratini de Moraes, a Brazilian minister, and his association with Berent Friele. Many invitations to dinner in honor of the Brazilian minister which Berent Friele presided over.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes long newspaper in style of letter condemning Fidel Castro for his communist regime in Cuba as well as statement announcing creation of Latin American Employment Information Office for Cuban refugees. Contains newspaper clippings and pamphlets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs of the Consul General of Brazil in New York, Carlos Jacyntho de Barros, presenting David Rockefeller the insignia of a Grand Officer of the National Order of the Southern Cross of Brazil. Also includes correspondence between Berent Friele and David Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters, memos, and messages relating to US-Brazilian relations, generally written from Friele to David Rockefeller although not exclusively. Includes letter from Friele to Rockefeller discussing one Augusto Antunes, a wealthy Brazilian private citizen who was in cooperation with them in improving the infrastructure of Brazil. Includes pamphlet on responsibility of American businesses by Chase. Also includes newspaper clipping on Brazilian use of nuclear energy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from David Rockefeller to Berent Friele thanking him for a message previously sent by the latter to the former.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many letters discussing US state relations with Brazil, primarily from Friele's point-of-view. Also includes newspaper clippings regarding state of US-Brazilian relations, especially concerning nuclear issues.

did.unittitle: Dinner in Honor of Galo Plaza

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of documents, correspondences, invitations, guest lists, itineraries, and letters relating to a dinner being held in honor of Ecuadorian President Galo Plaza by the OAS. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and messages passed between Berent Friele and his associates with last names beginning with E. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Berent Friele and Frank Nattier, an associate of Friele's active in the Office of Inter-American Affairs. Primarily concerns plans for a reunion of people involved in the office. Contains invitations as well as a postcard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters to David Rockefeller about oncoming regime change in Brazil including new president.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters regarding funding by the Rockefeller Foundation for the Cultura Artistica.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friele correspondence. Pamphlet for Brazilian Symphony Orchestra attended by Friele. Argentinian Ambassador Jorge Aja Espil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and messages passed between Berent Friele and his associates with last names beginning with G. Also includes photographs of a newly unveiled statue of Jose Marti sculpted by one Anna Hyatt Huntington.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been physically separated from the original file, and relocated to their own folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various letters of correspondence between Berent Friele and Galo Plaza as well as documents pertaining to the OAS.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - personal & confidential.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General correspondence between Berent Friele and Galo Plaza of Ecuador. Includes postcards and several copies of a long memorandum by Plaza titled "The New Crisis in the Hemisphere and How It Can Benefit the OAS" (Organization of American States).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with letters A-B. Includes newspaper clippings. Includes correspondence relating to IBEC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with letters C-D. Includes correspondence regarding a potential order of fishing vessels for IBEC and other documents involving trade as well as a proposal to fund a non-profit medical center. Contains newspaper articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with letters E-K. Includes some correspondence regarding the International Basic Economy Corporation. Includes newspaper clippings. Also includes a large report by the Kraft Foods Company on increasing dairy production.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with the letter L. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with letters M-N. Includes a receipt ticket for a sweepstakes and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with letters O-R, primarily of a business nature. Contains newspaper clippings and an invitation to a meeting of the Rockefeller Center Luncheon Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A variety of personal and business correspondence comprised of interactions between Berent Friele and associates with last names beginning with letters S-Z. Notably includes a memorandum from an annual meeting of stockholders for The Standard Oil Company. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A letter to David Rockefeller with an attached memorandum sent to Nelson Rockefeller regarding Moreira Salles, a successful Brazilian banker working with Nelson to strengthen the Brazilian financial sector.

did.unittitle: Governor's Committee for International Official Visitors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A large amount of correspondence and documents pertaining to foreign delegations to the United States, the preparations being made for them, and their itineraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Berent Friele and one Guillermo Belt in regards to their mutual acquaintance in Ecuadorian President Galo Plaza. Includes resume of Guillermo Belt.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted from scholarly access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with one Herberto Lanteri of the Camara de Exportadores, and organization lobbying for better trade regulations between the US and Latin America, specifically Argentina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Press, correspondence, and pamphlets with a focus on the unveiling of Brasilia, the new Brazilian capital. Contains newspaper clippings and a large program created for the inauguration of Brasilia written in Brazilian Portuguese.

did.unittitle: International Basic Economy Corporation and Other Letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assortment of letters written by Berent Friele usually in correspondence with associates from his time spent working with many organizations related to Latin America, most notably Brazil. Letter from Berent Friele's nephew about Bergen, Norway, their ancestral home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A detailed resume and curriculum vitae of one John Pepion, including letters of reference and correspondence and detailed work history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with former Ambassador to Ethiopia Joseph Simonson regarding the Norwegian-American museum in Decorah, Iowa. Includes pamphlets and photographs of museum.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - personal and confidential.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence between Berent Friele and former Brazilian President Juscelino Kubitschek. Also contains newspaper clippings and other information on Kubitschek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence and newspaper clippings related to and concerning the visit of King Olav V of Norway to the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter sent from Friele to David Rockefeller concerning the political situation in Brazil and the current "cool" relations between the US and Brazil. Also includes his own recommendations to Kissinger on how to better those relations.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller and "Frederick Billings" Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence regarding the reconstruction of a ship known as the "Frederick Billings" for use in a museum as a project of the United State Department of the Interior National Park Service. Contains many letters written in Danish.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller and King Olav Luncheon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and news press regarding the visit of King Olav V of Norway to the US as well as a luncheon in his honor. Contains newspaper clippings and postcards. Also contains short pamphlet titled Wings Club Bulletin which focuses on the world of aviation as well as the visit of the King of Norway.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller and King Olav Visit

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains further correspondence regarding the visit of King Olav V of Norway to the US as well as details of a luncheon held in honor of the king to which Berent Friele was invited. Also contains letters regarding a plaque unveiling controversy which coincided with the sesquicentennial of a Norwegian presence in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence between Berent Friele and one Lisa Von Friedberg whose son was put in jail in Venezuela and was requesting assistance from Nelson Rockefeller in freeing him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and messages passed between Berent Friele and his associates with last names beginning with M. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Mesbla S.A., a chain of department stores which existed in Brazil from 1912-1999. Contains a large pamphlet in Portuguese discussing the goals and achievements of Mesbla S.A.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper images and clippings with stories of missing Michael Rockefeller.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - personal and confidential.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Berent Friele and Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Joao Leitao de Abreu. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a large assortment of lists ranging from addresses of businesses and people to guests expected to attend certain events.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller Center for Social Science

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerns correspondence and details for the building of the Nelson A. Rockefeller Center for Social Science at Dartmouth College in memory of the late Vice President. Contains a pamphlet with the building plans and information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A memorandum on the 350th anniversary of the expeditions of explorers Henry Hudson and Samuel de Champlain and the celebrations to take place in honor of them in Governor Nelson Rockefeller's newly dedicated "Year of History". Contains facts and information pertaining to the celebration as well as preparations to be made.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and messages passed between Berent Friele and his associates with last names going from P through R. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Involves correspondence, pamphlets, and information regarding a program affiliated with Friele and Nelson Rockefeller which seeks to promote partnership by pairing regions of Latin America with individual states of the United States. Also includes letter from President Jimmy Carter congratulating the President of Partners of the Americas on his organization's achievements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains letter written by David Rockefeller to Peruvian economist and politician Pedro Beltran along with a thank you note to Nelson Rockefeller for inviting Friele and his wife to a party

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - personal and confidential.

did.unittitle: President-Elect Costa e Silva and David Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A single letter addressed to Berent Friele from a Brazilian dignitary, Jorge Paes de Carvalho, concerning several Brazilian statesmen visiting the United States and arranging a meeting for them with David and Nelson Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Berent Friele and one Jorge Paes de Carvalho, treasurer of the Rio Museum of Modern Art (MAM), about a recent shipment of glass to the museum which was broken in transit and needs to be replaced. Contains further correspondence regarding contributions and donations towards the museum's founding. Includes photographs of museum in stages of development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs and personal letters and correspondence from Rodman Rockefeller. Also includes a speech by Rodman Rockefeller delivered while he was President of IBEC (International Basic Economy Corporation).

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been physically separated from the original file, and relocated to their own folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friele's correspondence with persons involved in the Ski for Light program which involves promoting ski touring in Norway, in particular for the benefit of the the visually impaired and blind. Includes photos and pamphlet. The program was promoted by Rockefeller resorts such as Woodstock, Vermont as seen in a letter from Friele to Laurance Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with Stephen Low, a member of the Department of State and Ambassador to Zambia. Includes pictures and postcards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper articles, clippings, and magazines concerning Steven and Anne-Marie Rockefeller.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission is required in order to publish or otherwise use photographs and other visual materials of living members of the Rockefeller family. See RAC Head of Reference for details.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been physically separated from the original file, and relocated to their own folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and files pertaining to Berent Friele's visit to Brazil in the summer of 1950. Includes many documents discussing IBEC's affairs in Brazil as well as other business endeavors.

did.unittitle: Trip to Brazil General and Personal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A large assortment of correspondence, letters, and memorandums related to Berent Friele's 1952 visit to Brazil, primarily of a personal nature. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and photographs pertaining to a large forest preserve called Tumucumaque National Park located in Brazil.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been physically separated from the original file, and relocated to their own folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and programs pertaining to the University of the Andes Foundation and the contributions of Berent Friele and others to its development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and messages passed between Berent Friele and his associates with last names beginning with V. Contains an article with an obituary for recently deceased Brazilian President Vargas. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence to Berent Friele and David Rockefeller from Victor Andrade concerning a memorial ceremony held for Nelson Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and messages passed between Berent Friele and his associates with last names beginning with W. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The resume and curriculum vitae of one William B. Wimpenney, a businessman and manager who had applied for a position at IBEC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes brief correspondence between Berent Friele and Winthrop Rockefeller regarding congratulations over Winthrop's gubernatorial victory in Arkansas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence exclusively between Nelson A. Rockefeller and Berent Friele of both a business and personal nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes minutes of the annual board meeting for the AIFLD on which Nelson Rockefeller served. Topics of discussion include threat of communism in Latin America primarily stemming from Cuba. Includes statement of the AIFLD budget for 1978-1979 and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains letters from one Albert McNutt to Nelson Rockefeller regarding a civil engineering project in Latin America which he believes Nelson may be interested it. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Nelson Rockefeller and Berent Friele among other associates concerning Latin American affairs, primarily the Bi-National Brazilian Conference hosted by the Council on Foreign Relations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains several memos to Nelson Rockefeller concerning developments in Brazil, including the appointment of a new US Ambassador to Brazil, William Rountree, as well as several visits to the US by Brazilian dignitaries. Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Several telegrams drafted by Friele and sent by Nelson Rockefeller to a few recently elected presidents in various Latin American republics, including Costa Rica and Colombia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains documents pertaining to recent presidential elections in Brazil and Panama as well as newspaper articles. Also includes correspondence regarding contemporary Latin American events and visits between Nelson A. Rockefeller and one Walther Moreira Salles, a notable Brazilian banker and politician.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restricted from scholarly access - personal and confidential.
